00031 
00032 /*
00033 ===============================================================================
00034 egs_octree: an octree implementation to the egs++ geometry collection.
00035 ===============================================================================
00036 
00037 An octree is a way to partition space in a tree-like fashion, and it is a direct
00038 extension of binary trees to 3D. The idea is to start with a cuboid and divide
00039 it in half along each of the three cartesian axes to yield 8 children cuboids
00040 (hence the name "octree"), and so on recursively until some desired limit. One
00041 can restrict this subdivision scheme for any branch of the octree to obtain
00042 leaf cells of varying size: the resolution of the octree can vary spatially.
00043 
00044 The main motivation for coding an egs++ octree geometry is to increase the
00045 performance of large voxelized geometries such as a the human phantom. If we
00046 imagine individual voxels in the phantom to be the leaves of the octree, then we
00047 can merge voxels of same medium into larger cells and significantly reduce the
00048 overall number of regions, thus reducing the number of howfar calls.
00049 
00050 The geometry can handle multiple bounding boxes in order to model different part
00051 of the geometry at different resolutions (see example below). This can be used
00052 to model micromatrices, for example.
00053 
00054 Any egs++ geometry can be "octreefied". One defines a child geometry, a bounding
00055 box and the desired resolution, and the geometry will grow and prune the octree
00056 accordingly; the child geometry is simply used as an oracle that returns the
00057 local medium index for a given point. This approach allows one to use any
00058 existing input file and wrap an octree around it, so in effect in can also serve
00059 as a generic voxelizer (there is an option to disable pruning).
00060 
00061 More documentation will follow in the code, but you should be able to try it
00062 right away with your own geometries, following the examples I will commit to
00063 the egs++/geometry/examples. Please take it out for a spin on your own favorite
00064 geometry and let me know if it works well.
00065 
00066 Enjoy.
00067 
00068 
00069 ===============================================================================
00070 EXAMPLE:
00071 ===============================================================================
00072 
00073 Here is a simple example that defines a sphere and then models it with an octree
00074 in which the positive octant features a higher resolution:
00075 
00076 :start geometry definition:
00077 
00078     :start geometry:
00079         library         = egs_spheres
00080         name            = my_sphere
00081         :start media input:
00082             media       = my_medium
00083         :stop media input:
00084         midpoint        = 0 0 0
00085         radii           = 0.9
00086     :stop geometry:
00087 
00088     :start geometry:
00089         library         = egs_octree
00090         name            = my_octree
00091         :start octree box:
00092             box min     = -1 -1 -1
00093             box max     = 1 1 1
00094             resolution  = 32 32 32
00095         :stop octree box:
00096         :start octree box:
00097             box min     = 0 0 0
00098             box max     = 1 1 1
00099             resolution  = 128 128 128
00100         :stop octree box:
00101         child geometry  = my_sphere
00102     :stop geometry:
00103 
00104      simulation geometry = my_octree
00105 
00106 :stop geometry definition:
00107 
00108 
00109 ===============================================================================
00110 PERFORMANCE:
00111 ===============================================================================
00112 
00113 I tested the octree geometry on the fax06 human phantom to check what kind of
00114 gains can be achieved. Using the howfar time test from the geometry tester, I
00115 found the following:
00116 
00117 fax06 human phantom:
00118 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00119 model        # cells    avg cell size    avg # steps     time / sample (on tux)
00120 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00121 voxels     141716520             0.12            284             14 us
00122 octree       9045359             0.30             46             20 us
00123 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00124 GAIN            94 %                            84 %             32 %
00125 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00126 
00127 There is a major gain in the number of cells and the number of howfar calls,
00128 but the performance increase is mitigated by the more intricate logic for
00129 navigating in the octree (finding neighbors etc.). So the performance increase
00130 is only 32%, as opposed to the 84% that could be expected solely from the
00131 decrease of the number of steps. Of course, all these numbers are model
00132 specific, and the gain will be better for geometries in which there are large
00133 volumes of uniform medium.
00134 
00135 
00136 ===============================================================================
00137 MEMORY:
00138 ===============================================================================
00139 
00140 Each node in the final octree (the number of reported regions) requires 46
00141 bytes of memory (on 64-bit machines), that is, 38 bytes for each instance of
00142 the node EGS_OCtree_node class and 8 bytes for a pointer to the node in the
00143 region list. So for example the fax06 phantom requires about 400 MB of memory
00144 (but it shows up as using about 600 MB, so maybe there is a leak?).
00145 
00146 
00147 ===============================================================================
00148 TODO:
00149 ===============================================================================
00150 
00151 1. Add an option in the VHP geometry to represent the model with an octree, and
00152 perhaps implement a bottom-up octree growth algorithm if it can be faster than
00153 the current recursive method.
00154 
00155 2. Add the option to merge voxels when a certain proportion of the children
00156 nodes have the same medium.
00157 
00158 3. Add the option to set the resolution depending on the medium or other
00159 criteria than bounding boxes?
00160 
00161 =============================================================================
00162 */
00163 
00164

00202 class EGS_Octree_bbox {
00203 public:
00204     EGS_Vector  vmin, vmax;
00205     int         level, maxlevel;
00206     int         ixmin, iymin, izmin;
00207     int         ixmax, iymax, izmax;
00208     int         nx, ny, nz;
00209 
00210     // constructor
00211     EGS_Octree_bbox (const EGS_Vector &boxMin, const EGS_Vector &boxMax, vector<int> &bboxRes) :
00212         vmin(boxMin), vmax(boxMax), nx(bboxRes[0]), ny(bboxRes[1]), nz(bboxRes[2]) {
00213         maxlevel = 0;
00214         ixmin = iymin = izmin = 0;
00215         ixmax = iymax = izmax = 0;
00216     }
00217 
00218     // addition
00219     EGS_Octree_bbox operator+ (const EGS_Octree_bbox &b2) const {
00220 
00221         EGS_Octree_bbox b1(*this);
00222 
00223         // set the b1 box limits to enclose the two boxes
00224         if (b2.vmin.x < b1.vmin.x) b1.vmin.x = b2.vmin.x;
00225         if (b2.vmin.y < b1.vmin.y) b1.vmin.y = b2.vmin.y;
00226         if (b2.vmin.z < b1.vmin.z) b1.vmin.z = b2.vmin.z;
00227         if (b2.vmax.x > b1.vmax.x) b1.vmax.x = b2.vmax.x;
00228         if (b2.vmax.y > b1.vmax.y) b1.vmax.y = b2.vmax.y;
00229         if (b2.vmax.z > b1.vmax.z) b1.vmax.z = b2.vmax.z;
00230 
00231         // calculate voxel sizes for the two boxes
00232         EGS_Float dx1 = (b1.vmax.x-b1.vmin.x)/b1.nx;
00233         EGS_Float dy1 = (b1.vmax.y-b1.vmin.y)/b1.ny;
00234         EGS_Float dz1 = (b1.vmax.z-b1.vmin.z)/b1.nz;
00235         EGS_Float dx2 = (b2.vmax.x-b2.vmin.x)/b2.nx;
00236         EGS_Float dy2 = (b2.vmax.y-b2.vmin.y)/b2.ny;
00237         EGS_Float dz2 = (b2.vmax.z-b2.vmin.z)/b2.nz;
00238 
00239         // calculate the number of voxels in the overall box b1 (using the highest resolution of b1 and b2)
00240         if (dx2 < dx1) b1.nx = (int) ((b1.vmax.x - b1.vmin.x + 0.5*dx2) / dx2); else b1.nx = (int)((b1.vmax.x - b1.vmin.x +0.5*dx1) / dx1);
00241         if (dy2 < dy1) b1.ny = (int) ((b1.vmax.y - b1.vmin.y + 0.5*dy2) / dy2); else b1.ny = (int)((b1.vmax.y - b1.vmin.y +0.5*dy1) / dy1);
00242         if (dz2 < dz1) b1.nz = (int) ((b1.vmax.z - b1.vmin.z + 0.5*dz2) / dz2); else b1.nz = (int)((b1.vmax.z - b1.vmin.z +0.5*dz1) / dz1);
00243 
00244         // return the overall box b1
00245         return b1;
00246     }
00247 
00248     EGS_Octree_bbox &operator+= (const EGS_Octree_bbox &b2) {
00249 
00250         // set the b1 box limits to enclose the two boxes
00251         if (b2.vmin.x < vmin.x) vmin.x = b2.vmin.x;
00252         if (b2.vmin.y < vmin.y) vmin.y = b2.vmin.y;
00253         if (b2.vmin.z < vmin.z) vmin.z = b2.vmin.z;
00254         if (b2.vmax.x > vmax.x) vmax.x = b2.vmax.x;
00255         if (b2.vmax.y > vmax.y) vmax.y = b2.vmax.y;
00256         if (b2.vmax.z > vmax.z) vmax.z = b2.vmax.z;
00257 
00258         // calculate voxel sizes for the two boxes
00259         EGS_Float dx1 = (vmax.x-vmin.x)/nx;
00260         EGS_Float dy1 = (vmax.y-vmin.y)/ny;
00261         EGS_Float dz1 = (vmax.z-vmin.z)/nz;
00262         EGS_Float dx2 = (b2.vmax.x-b2.vmin.x)/b2.nx;
00263         EGS_Float dy2 = (b2.vmax.y-b2.vmin.y)/b2.ny;
00264         EGS_Float dz2 = (b2.vmax.z-b2.vmin.z)/b2.nz;
00265 
00266         // calculate the number of voxels in the overall box b1 (using the highest resolution of b1 and b2)
00267         if (dx2 < dx1) nx = (int) ((vmax.x - vmin.x + 0.5*dx2) / dx2); else nx = (int)((vmax.x - vmin.x +0.5*dx1) / dx1);
00268         if (dy2 < dy1) ny = (int) ((vmax.y - vmin.y + 0.5*dy2) / dy2); else ny = (int)((vmax.y - vmin.y +0.5*dy1) / dy1);
00269         if (dz2 < dz1) nz = (int) ((vmax.z - vmin.z + 0.5*dz2) / dz2); else nz = (int)((vmax.z - vmin.z +0.5*dz1) / dz1);
00270 
00271         // return the overall box
00272         return *this;
00273     }
00274 };
00275 
00276 
00277 class EGS_Octree_node {
00278 public:
00279     int             ix, iy, iz;                                 
00280     int             region;                                     
00281     short           medium;                                     
00282     unsigned short  level;                                      
00283     EGS_Octree_node *child;                                     
00284     EGS_Octree_node *parent;                                    
00285 
00286     // constructor
00287     EGS_Octree_node () {
00288         medium = -1;                                            // set the medium to -1 by default
00289         region = -1;                                            // set region to -1 by default
00290         level  = 0;                                             // set level to 0 (root) by default
00291         ix = iy = iz = 0;                                       // set octree indices to 0 by default
00292         child = NULL;                                           // the node has no children initially
00293         parent = NULL;                                          // the node has no parent initially
00294     }
00295 
00296     // create children nodes
00297     void createChildren() {                                     // create children to the this node
00298         if (!child) {                                           // ensure there are no children already
00299             child = new EGS_Octree_node [8];                    // allocate memory for 8 new children nodes
00300             if (!child) egsFatal("EGS_Octree_node::createChildren(): Memory allocation error");
00301             for (int i=0; i<8; i++) {                           // loop over all 8 newly created children nodes
00302                 child[i].level = level+1;                       // increase level by 1 compared to current level
00303                 child[i].ix = (ix << 1) | (i>>0 & 0x1);         // shift up ix by one, and set new bit to that of the child index's bit 0 (x position)
00304                 child[i].iy = (iy << 1) | (i>>1 & 0x1);         // shift up iy by one, and set new bit to that of the child index's bit 1 (y position)
00305                 child[i].iz = (iz << 1) | (i>>2 & 0x1);         // shift up iz by one, and set new bit to that of the child index's bit 2 (z position)
00306                 child[i].parent = this;                         // set the parent pointer of every child to the current node
00307             }
00308         }
00309     }
00310 
00311     // delete children (recursively)
00312     void deleteChildren () {                                    // delete children of this node
00313         if (child) {                                            // if this node has children, delete them
00314             for (int i=0; i<8; i++) child[i].deleteChildren();  // recursive calls to delete all children branches
00315             delete [] child;                                    // free the memory allocated for the 8 children
00316             child = NULL;                                       // set children pointer to NULL to indicate that there are no children now
00317         }
00318     }
00319 
00320     // collapse node
00321     int collapseChildren () {                                   // collapse children in this node if they are all the same medium
00322         if (child) {                                            // check that we indeed have children
00323             for (int i=0; i<8; i++) {                           // loop over each of the 8 children of this node
00324                 if (child[i].child) return 0;                   // bail out if there are nodes below the children (this could be made recursive)
00325                 if (child[i].medium!=child[0].medium) return 0; // bail out as soon as one children has a different medium
00326             }
00327             medium = child[0].medium;                           // set the medium of this node to that of the children
00328             deleteChildren();                                   // delete the children of this node
00329             return 1;                                           // return 1 to indicate that the children were collapsed
00330         }
00331         return 0;
00332     }
00333 
00334     // insideBBox
00335     bool insideBBox (EGS_Octree_bbox &bbox) {
00336         int shift = bbox.maxlevel - level;
00337         int ii;
00338         ii = (ix<<shift);   if (ii < bbox.ixmin) return false;
00339         ii = ~(~ix<<shift); if (ii > bbox.ixmax) return false;
00340         ii = (iy<<shift);   if (ii < bbox.iymin) return false;
00341         ii = ~(~iy<<shift); if (ii > bbox.iymax) return false;
00342         ii = iz<<shift;     if (ii < bbox.izmin) return false;
00343         ii = ~(~iz<<shift); if (ii > bbox.izmax) return false;
00344         return true;
00345     }
00346 
00347     // instersectBBox
00348     bool intersectBBox (EGS_Octree_bbox &bbox) {
00349 
00350         int shift = bbox.maxlevel - level;
00351         int iimin, iimax;
00352 
00353         iimin = (ix<<shift);   if (bbox.ixmin > iimin) iimin = bbox.ixmin;
00354         iimax = ~(~ix<<shift); if (bbox.ixmax < iimax) iimax = bbox.ixmax;
00355         if (iimax < iimin) return false;
00356 
00357         iimin = (iy<<shift);   if (bbox.iymin > iimin) iimin = bbox.iymin;
00358         iimax = ~(~iy<<shift); if (bbox.iymax < iimax) iimax = bbox.iymax;
00359         if (iimax < iimin) return false;
00360 
00361         iimin = (iz<<shift);   if (bbox.izmin > iimin) iimin = bbox.izmin;
00362         iimax = ~(~iz<<shift); if (bbox.izmax < iimax) iimax = bbox.izmax;
00363         if (iimax < iimin) return false;
00364 
00365         return true;
00366     }
00367 };

00414 class EGS_OCTREE_EXPORT EGS_Octree : public EGS_BaseGeometry {
00415 
00416     EGS_Octree_node         *root;                              
00417     EGS_Octree_node         **nodeReg;                          
00418     EGS_BaseGeometry        *geom;                              
00419     EGS_Float               bbxmin, bbymin, bbzmin;             
00420     EGS_Float               bbxmax, bbymax, bbzmax;             
00421     EGS_Float               xmin, ymin, zmin;                   
00422     EGS_Float               xmax, ymax, zmax;                   
00423     EGS_Float               dx, dy, dz, dxi, dyi, dzi;          
00424     int                     ixmin, iymin, izmin;                
00425     int                     ixmax, iymax, izmax;                
00426     int                     maxlevel, n;                        
00427     int                     nx, ny, nz;                         
00428     static string           type;                               
00429     long int                nLeaf, nLeafMax;                    
00430     vector<EGS_Octree_node *> tmp;                              
00431 
00432 public:
00433 
00434     EGS_Octree (vector<EGS_Octree_bbox> &vBox, bool pruneTree, EGS_BaseGeometry *g) : EGS_BaseGeometry(""), geom(g) {
00435 
00436         // combine bounding boxes to get the overall bounding box
00437         EGS_Octree_bbox bbox(vBox[0]);
00438         for (int i=1; i<vBox.size(); i++) bbox += vBox[i];
00439         vBox.push_back(bbox);
00440 
00441         // save overall resolution
00442         nx = bbox.nx;
00443         ny = bbox.ny;
00444         nz = bbox.nz;
00445 
00446         // set size of cells at maxlevel
00447         dx = (bbox.vmax.x - bbox.vmin.x) / bbox.nx;
00448         dy = (bbox.vmax.y - bbox.vmin.y) / bbox.ny;
00449         dz = (bbox.vmax.z - bbox.vmin.z) / bbox.nz;
00450 
00451         // pre-compute cell size inverses to save time
00452         dxi = 1.0/dx;
00453         dyi = 1.0/dy;
00454         dzi = 1.0/dz;
00455 
00456         // set octree depth (maxlevel)
00457         int res = nx;
00458         if (ny > res) res = ny;
00459         if (nz > res) res = nz;
00460         maxlevel = (int) ceil(log((EGS_Float)res)/0.6931471805599452862);
00461 
00462         // set octree cell count at maxlevel;
00463         n = 1<<maxlevel;
00464 
00465         // set octree bounds in space
00466         xmin = bbox.vmin.x;
00467         ymin = bbox.vmin.y;
00468         zmin = bbox.vmin.z;
00469         xmax = bbox.vmin.x + dx*n;
00470         ymax = bbox.vmin.y + dy*n;
00471         zmax = bbox.vmin.z + dz*n;
00472 
00473         // set cell indices range for each box;
00474         {for (int i=0; i<vBox.size(); i++) {
00475             EGS_Octree_bbox *box = &vBox[i];
00476             box->ixmin = (int) ((box->vmin.x - xmin + 0.5*dx) * dxi);
00477             box->iymin = (int) ((box->vmin.y - ymin + 0.5*dy) * dyi);
00478             box->izmin = (int) ((box->vmin.z - zmin + 0.5*dz) * dzi);
00479             box->nx    = (int) ((box->vmax.x - box->vmin.x + 0.5*dx) * dxi);
00480             box->ny    = (int) ((box->vmax.y - box->vmin.y + 0.5*dy) * dyi);
00481             box->nz    = (int) ((box->vmax.z - box->vmin.z + 0.5*dz) * dzi);
00482             box->ixmax = box->ixmin + box->nx - 1;
00483             box->iymax = box->iymin + box->ny - 1;
00484             box->izmax = box->izmin + box->nz - 1;
00485             if (box->ixmin<0) box->ixmin = 0; if (box->ixmax>=n) box->ixmax = n-1;
00486             if (box->iymin<0) box->iymin = 0; if (box->iymax>=n) box->iymax = n-1;
00487             if (box->izmin<0) box->izmin = 0; if (box->izmax>=n) box->izmax = n-1;
00488             box->nx = box->ixmax - box->ixmin + 1;
00489             box->ny = box->iymax - box->iymin + 1;
00490             box->nz = box->izmax - box->izmin + 1;
00491         }}
00492 
00493 
00494         // determine maxlevel in each defined bounding box
00495 //         {for (int i=0; i<vBox.size(); i++) {
00496 //             EGS_Octree_bbox *box = &vBox[i];
00497 //             EGS_Float scale = box->nxtree/(EGS_Float)box->nx;
00498 //             if (box->nytree/box->ny > scale) scale = box->nytree/(EGS_Float)box->ny;
00499 //             if (box->nztree/box->nz > scale) scale = box->nztree/(EGS_Float)box->nz;
00500 //             int difflevel = (int) ceil (log(scale)/0.6931471805599452862);
00501 //             box->maxlevel = maxlevel;
00502 //             box->level    = maxlevel-difflevel;
00503 //         }}
00504 
00505         // avoid indirections for overall bounding box parameters
00506         EGS_Octree_bbox *box = &(vBox.back());
00507         bbxmin = box->vmin.x; bbxmax = box->vmax.x;
00508         bbymin = box->vmin.y; bbymax = box->vmax.y;
00509         bbzmin = box->vmin.z; bbzmax = box->vmax.z;
00510         ixmin  = box->ixmin; ixmax  = box->ixmax;
00511         iymin  = box->iymin; iymax  = box->iymax;
00512         izmin  = box->izmin; izmax  = box->izmax;
00513 
00514         // build octree
00515         root = new EGS_Octree_node ();
00516         growOctree (root, vBox, pruneTree);
00517 
00518         // allocate memory to hold the region-indexed node pointers in a simple array, and free up the tmp vector
00519         nreg = tmp.size();
00520         nodeReg = new EGS_Octree_node* [nreg];
00521         {for (int i=0; i<nreg; i++) nodeReg[i] = tmp[i];}
00522         tmp.erase(tmp.begin(),tmp.end());
00523 
00524         // calculate leaf node statistics
00525         nLeaf = 0;
00526         nLeafMax = 0;
00527         statOctree(root, vBox);
00528     }
00529 
00530 
00531     // destructor
00532     ~EGS_Octree () {
00533         if (root) {
00534             root->deleteChildren();
00535             delete root;
00536             delete [] nodeReg;
00537         }
00538     }
00539 
00540 
00541     // statOctree
00542     void statOctree (EGS_Octree_node *node, vector<EGS_Octree_bbox> &vBox) {
00543         if (node->child) {
00544             for (int i=0; i<8; i++) statOctree(node->child+i, vBox);
00545         }
00546         else if (node->insideBBox(vBox[vBox.size()-1]) && node->medium>=0) {
00547             int shift = maxlevel - node->level;
00548             nLeaf++;
00549             nLeafMax += 1<<(3*shift);
00550         }
00551     }
00552 
00553 
00554     // growOctree (recursive)
00555     void growOctree (EGS_Octree_node *node, vector<EGS_Octree_bbox> &vBox, bool prune) {
00556 
00557         // assume node needs no refinement
00558         bool refineNode = false;
00559 
00560         // check if we need to refine this node
00561         if (node->level < maxlevel) {
00562 
00563             // check all bounding boxes to determine local refinement level (priority to boxes defined later)
00564             int level = 0;
00565             {for (int i=0; i<vBox.size()-1; i++) {
00566                 int boxlevel = vBox[i].level;
00567                 if (node->insideBBox(vBox[i])) level = boxlevel;
00568             }}
00569 
00570             // node may still need refinement if it intersects a higher resolution bounding box
00571             {for (int i=0; i<vBox.size()-1; i++) {
00572                 int boxlevel = vBox[i].level;
00573                 if (!node->insideBBox(vBox[i]) && node->intersectBBox(vBox[i])) {
00574                     if (boxlevel > level) level = boxlevel;
00575                 }
00576             }}
00577 
00578             // if the level of this node is not sufficient, set it for refinement
00579             if (node->level < level) refineNode = true;
00580         }
00581 
00582         // if this node needs refinement, grow children branches (recursively), and then try to collapse children
00583         if (refineNode) {
00584             node->createChildren();
00585             for (int i=0; i<8; i++) {
00586                 growOctree(node->child+i, vBox, prune);
00587             }
00588             if (prune) {
00589                 if (node->collapseChildren()) {
00590                     tmp.resize(tmp.size()-8);
00591                     node->region = tmp.size();
00592                     tmp.push_back(node);
00593                 }
00594             }
00595         }
00596         // otherwise this node is a leaf: set the node medium and add it to the region list
00597         else {
00598             bool insideSomeBox = false;
00599             for (int i=0; i<vBox.size()-1; i++) {
00600                 if (node->insideBBox(vBox[i])) {
00601                     insideSomeBox = true;
00602                     break;
00603                 }
00604             }
00605             node->medium = -1;
00606             if (insideSomeBox) {
00607                 int shift = maxlevel - node->level;
00608                 int ix = node->ix << shift;
00609                 int iy = node->iy << shift;
00610                 int iz = node->iz << shift;
00611                 float xx = xmin+(ix+0.5)*dx;
00612                 float yy = ymin+(iy+0.5)*dy;
00613                 float zz = zmin+(iz+0.5)*dz;
00614                 int ireg = geom->isWhere(EGS_Vector(xmin+(ix+0.5)*dx, ymin+(iy+0.5)*dy, zmin+(iz+0.5)*dz));
00615                 if (ireg>=0) node->medium = geom->medium(ireg);
00616             }
00617             node->region = tmp.size();
00618             tmp.push_back(node);
00619         }
00620     }
00621 
00622 
00623     // getNeighborNodeX
00624     EGS_Octree_node *getNeighborNodeX (EGS_Octree_node *node, int ixn, int iyn, int izn) {
00625 
00626         // check if neighbor index is in range
00627         if (ixn < ixmin || ixn > ixmax) return NULL;
00628 
00629         // constrain neighbor indices in y and z
00630         int shift = maxlevel - node->level;
00631         if      (iyn < node->iy<<shift)      iyn = node->iy<<shift;
00632         else if (iyn > ~(~node->iy<<shift))  iyn = ~(~node->iy<<shift);
00633         if      (izn < node->iz<<shift)      izn = node->iz<<shift;
00634         else if (izn > ~(~node->iz<<shift))  izn = ~(~node->iz<<shift);
00635 
00636         // walk up and down the octree to new cell
00637         int diff  = node->ix ^ (ixn>>shift);
00638         shift = 0;
00639         while (diff & (1<<shift)) {
00640             node = node->parent;
00641             shift++;
00642         }
00643         shift = maxlevel - node->level;
00644         while (node->child) {
00645             shift--;
00646             int childIndex;
00647             childIndex  = (ixn>>shift & 0x1);
00648             childIndex |= (iyn>>shift & 0x1) << 1;
00649             childIndex |= (izn>>shift & 0x1) << 2;
00650             node = node->child + childIndex;
00651         }
00652         shift = maxlevel - node->level;
00653 
00654         return node;
00655     }
00656 
00657 
00658     // getNeighborNodeY
00659     EGS_Octree_node *getNeighborNodeY (EGS_Octree_node * node, int ixn, int iyn, int izn) {
00660 
00661         // check if neighbor index is in range
00662         if (iyn < iymin || iyn > iymax) return NULL;
00663 
00664         // constrain neighbor indices in x and z
00665         int shift = maxlevel - node->level;
00666         if      (ixn < node->ix<<shift)      ixn = node->ix<<shift;
00667         else if (ixn > ~(~node->ix<<shift))  ixn = ~(~node->ix<<shift);
00668         if      (izn < node->iz<<shift)      izn = node->iz<<shift;
00669         else if (izn > ~(~node->iz<<shift))  izn = ~(~node->iz<<shift);
00670 
00671         // walk up and down the octree to new cell
00672         int diff  = node->iy ^ (iyn>>shift);
00673         shift = 0;
00674         while (diff & (1<<shift)) {
00675             node = node->parent;
00676             shift++;
00677         }
00678         shift = maxlevel - node->level;
00679         while (node->child) {
00680             shift--;
00681             int childIndex;
00682             childIndex  = (ixn>>shift & 0x1);
00683             childIndex |= (iyn>>shift & 0x1) << 1;
00684             childIndex |= (izn>>shift & 0x1) << 2;
00685             node = node->child + childIndex;
00686         }
00687         return node;
00688     }
00689 
00690 
00691     // getNeighborNodeZ
00692     EGS_Octree_node *getNeighborNodeZ (EGS_Octree_node * node, int ixn, int iyn, int izn) {
00693 
00694         // check if neighbor index is in range
00695         if (izn < izmin || izn > izmax) return NULL;
00696 
00697         // constrain neighbor indices in x and y
00698         int shift = maxlevel - node->level;
00699         if      (ixn < node->ix<<shift)      ixn = node->ix<<shift;
00700         else if (ixn > ~(~node->ix<<shift))  ixn = ~(~node->ix<<shift);
00701         if      (iyn < node->iy<<shift)      iyn = node->iy<<shift;
00702         else if (iyn > ~(~node->iy<<shift))  iyn = ~(~node->iy<<shift);
00703 
00704         // walk up and down the octree to new cell
00705         int diff  = node->iz ^ (izn>>shift);
00706         shift = 0;
00707         while (diff & (1<<shift)) {
00708             node = node->parent;
00709             shift++;
00710         }
00711         shift = maxlevel - node->level;
00712         while (node->child) {
00713             shift--;
00714             int childIndex;
00715             childIndex  = (ixn>>shift & 0x1);
00716             childIndex |= (iyn>>shift & 0x1) << 1;
00717             childIndex |= (izn>>shift & 0x1) << 2;
00718             node = node->child + childIndex;
00719         }
00720         return node;
00721     }
00722 
00723 
00724     // getNode
00725     EGS_Octree_node *getNode (int ix, int iy, int iz) {
00726         if ((ix<ixmin) || (ix>ixmax) || (iy<iymin) || (iy>iymax) || (iz<izmin) || (iz>izmax)) return NULL;
00727         EGS_Octree_node *node = root;
00728         int shift = maxlevel;
00729         while (node->child) {
00730             shift--;
00731             int childIndex;
00732             childIndex  = (ix>>shift & 0x1);
00733             childIndex |= (iy>>shift & 0x1) << 1;
00734             childIndex |= (iz>>shift & 0x1) << 2;
00735             node = node->child + childIndex;
00736         }
00737         return node;
00738     }
00739 
00740 
00741     // setIndices
00742     void setIndices (const EGS_Vector &r, int &ix, int &iy, int &iz) {
00743         ix = (int) ((r.x-xmin)*dxi);
00744         iy = (int) ((r.y-ymin)*dyi);
00745         iz = (int) ((r.z-zmin)*dzi);
00746         if (ix<ixmin) ix=ixmin; if (ix>ixmax) ix=ixmax;
00747         if (iy<iymin) iy=iymin; if (iy>iymax) iy=iymax;
00748         if (iz<izmin) iz=izmin; if (iz>izmax) iz=izmax;
00749     }
00750 
00751 
00752     // isInside
00753     bool isInside (const EGS_Vector &r) {
00754         if (r.x >= bbxmin && r.x <= bbxmax &&
00755             r.y >= bbymin && r.y <= bbymax &&
00756             r.z >= bbzmin && r.z <= bbzmax ) return true;
00757         return false;
00758     }
00759 
00760 
00761     // isWhere
00762     int isWhere (const EGS_Vector &r) {
00763         if (!isInside(r)) return -1;
00764         int ix, iy, iz;
00765         setIndices(r,ix,iy,iz);
00766         return getNode(ix,iy,iz)->region;
00767     }
00768 
00769 
00770     // inside (deprecated)
00771     int inside (const EGS_Vector &r) {
00772         return isWhere(r);
00773     }
00774

00776     // isWhereFast
00777     int isWhereFast (const EGS_Vector &r) {
00778         if (!isInside(r)) return -1;
00779         int ix, iy, iz;
00780         setIndices(r, ix, iy, iz);
00781         return getNode(ix,iy,iz)->region;
00782     }

00787         return nodeReg[ireg]->medium;

00790 
00791     // howfarIn
00792     int howfarIn (EGS_Octree_node *node, const EGS_Vector &r, const EGS_Vector &u, EGS_Float &t, EGS_Vector *normal=0) {
00793 
00794         int ix, iy, iz, tmp;
00795         int crossed = -1;
00796 
00797         if (!node) return -1;
00798 
00799         // set shift and local cell indices
00800         int shift = maxlevel - node->level;                     // how many levels missing between current level and full depth
00801         ix = node->ix;
00802         iy = node->iy;
00803         iz = node->iz;
00804 
00805         // x direction
00806         if (u.x > 0) {
00807             ix = ~(~ix<<shift);                                 // fill lower level bits with 1's to always consider +x below current node
00808             EGS_Float xBound;
00809             if (ix>=ixmax) xBound = bbxmax;
00810             else xBound = xmin + (ix+1)*dx;
00811             EGS_Float d = (xBound-r.x) / u.x;
00812             if (d <= t) {
00813                 t = d;
00814                 crossed = 0;
00815                 ix++;
00816                 if (normal) *normal = EGS_Vector(-1,0,0);
00817             }
00818         }
00819         else if (u.x < 0) {
00820             ix = ix<<shift;                                     // fill lower level bits with 0's to always consider -x below current node
00821             EGS_Float xBound;
00822             if (ix<=ixmin) xBound = bbxmin;
00823             else xBound = xmin + ix*dx;
00824             EGS_Float d = (xBound-r.x) / u.x;
00825             if (d <= t) {
00826                 t = d;
00827                 crossed = 0;
00828                 ix--;
00829                 if (normal) *normal = EGS_Vector(1,0,0);
00830             }
00831         }
00832 
00833 
00834         // y direction
00835         if (u.y > 0) {
00836             iy = ~(~iy<<shift);                                 // fill lower level bits with 1's to always consider +y below current node
00837             EGS_Float yBound;
00838             if (iy>=iymax) yBound = bbymax;
00839             else yBound = ymin + (iy+1)*dy;
00840             EGS_Float d = (yBound - r.y) / u.y;
00841             if (d <= t) {
00842                 t = d;
00843                 crossed = 1;
00844                 iy++;
00845                 if (normal) *normal = EGS_Vector(0,-1,0);
00846             }
00847         }
00848         else if (u.y < 0) {
00849             iy = iy<<shift;                                     // fill lower level bits with 0's to always consider -y below current node
00850             EGS_Float yBound;
00851             if (iy<=iymin) yBound = bbymin;
00852             else yBound = ymin + iy*dy;
00853             EGS_Float d = (yBound-r.y) / u.y;
00854             if (d <= t) {
00855                 t = d;
00856                 crossed = 1;
00857                 iy--;
00858                 if (normal) *normal = EGS_Vector (0,1,0);
00859             }
00860         }
00861 
00862         // z direction
00863         if (u.z > 0) {
00864             iz = ~(~iz<<shift);                                 // fill lower level bits with 1's to always consider +z below current node
00865             EGS_Float zBound;
00866             if (iz>=izmax) zBound = bbzmax;
00867             else zBound = zmin + (iz+1)*dz;
00868             EGS_Float d = (zBound-r.z) / u.z;
00869             if (d <= t) {
00870                 t = d;
00871                 crossed = 2;
00872                 iz++;
00873                 if (normal) *normal = EGS_Vector(0,0,-1);
00874             }
00875         }
00876         else if (u.z < 0) {
00877             iz = iz<<shift;                                     // fill lower level bits with 0's to always consider -z below current node
00878             EGS_Float zBound;
00879             if (iz<=izmin) zBound = bbzmin;
00880             else zBound = zmin + iz*dz;
00881             EGS_Float d = (zBound-r.z) / u.z;
00882             if (d <= t) {
00883                 t = d;
00884                 crossed = 2;
00885                 iz--;
00886                 if (normal) *normal = EGS_Vector(0,0,1);
00887             }
00888         }
00889 
00890         // get the new region index for the neighbor cell:
00891         // 1) find the new position in the plane perpendicular to the crossing direction
00892         // 2) get the indices for the neighbor cell at maximum depth, corresponding to that position
00893         // 3) call an axis specific function to get the neighbor node
00894         if (crossed==0) {
00895             EGS_Vector ryz (r.x, r.y+t*u.y, r.z+t*u.z);
00896             setIndices(ryz, tmp, iy, iz);
00897             node = getNeighborNodeX (node, ix, iy, iz);
00898         }
00899         else if (crossed==1) {
00900             EGS_Vector rxz (r.x+t*u.x, r.y, r.z+t*u.z);
00901             setIndices(rxz, ix, tmp, iz);
00902             node = getNeighborNodeY (node, ix, iy, iz);
00903         }
00904         else if (crossed==2) {
00905             EGS_Vector rxy (r.x+t*u.x, r.y+t*u.y, r.z);
00906             setIndices(rxy, ix, iy, tmp);
00907             node = getNeighborNodeZ (node, ix, iy, iz);
00908         }
00909 
00910         if (node) return node->region;
00911         else return -1;
00912     }
00913 
00914 
00915     // howfarOut
00916     int howfarOut (const EGS_Vector &r, const EGS_Vector &u, EGS_Float &t, EGS_Vector *normal=0) {
00917 
00918         int inew = -1, tmp;
00919         int ix, iy, iz;
00920         EGS_Float d, tlong = 2*t;
00921         EGS_Octree_node *node = NULL;
00922 
00923         // x axis
00924         if (r.x <= bbxmin && u.x > 0) {
00925             ix = ixmin;
00926             d = (bbxmin-r.x) / u.x;
00927         }
00928         else if (r.x >= bbxmax && u.x < 0 ) {
00929             ix = ixmax;
00930             d = (bbxmax-r.x) / u.x;
00931         }
00932         else d = tlong;
00933         if (d <= t) {
00934             EGS_Float yy = r.y + u.y*d;
00935             EGS_Float zz = r.z + u.z*d;
00936             if (yy >= bbymin && yy <= bbymax && zz >= bbzmin && zz <= bbzmax) {
00937                 EGS_Vector rr(0,yy,zz);
00938                 setIndices(rr, tmp, iy, iz);
00939                 t = d;
00940                 if (normal) *normal = (ix == ixmin) ? EGS_Vector(-1,0,0) : EGS_Vector(1,0,0);
00941                 node = getNode(ix,iy,iz);
00942                 return node->region;
00943             }
00944         }
00945 
00946         // y axis
00947         if (r.y <= bbymin && u.y > 0 ) {
00948             iy = iymin;
00949             d = (bbymin-r.y) / u.y;
00950         }
00951         else if (r.y >= bbymax && u.y < 0 ) {
00952             iy = iymax;
00953             d = (bbymax-r.y) / u.y;
00954         }
00955         else d = tlong;
00956         if (d <= t) {
00957             EGS_Float xx = r.x + u.x*d;
00958             EGS_Float zz = r.z + u.z*d;
00959             if (xx >= bbxmin && xx <= bbxmax && zz >= bbzmin && zz <= bbzmax) {
00960                 EGS_Vector rr(xx,0,zz);
00961                 setIndices(rr, ix, tmp, iz);
00962                 t = d;
00963                 if (normal) *normal = (iy == iymin) ? EGS_Vector(0,-1,0) : EGS_Vector(0,1,0);
00964                 node = getNode(ix,iy,iz);
00965                 return node->region;
00966             }
00967          }
00968 
00969         // z axis
00970         if (r.z <= bbzmin && u.z > 0) {
00971             iz = izmin;
00972             d = (bbzmin-r.z) / u.z;
00973         }
00974         else if (r.z >= bbzmax && u.z < 0 ) {
00975             iz = izmax;
00976             d = (bbzmax-r.z) / u.z;
00977         }
00978         else d = tlong;
00979         if (d <= t) {
00980             EGS_Float xx = r.x + u.x*d;
00981             EGS_Float yy = r.y + u.y*d;
00982             if (xx >= bbxmin && xx <= bbxmax && yy >= bbymin && yy <= bbymax) {
00983                 EGS_Vector rr(xx,yy,0);
00984                 setIndices(rr, ix, iy, tmp);
00985                 t = d;
00986                 if (normal) *normal = (iz == izmin) ? EGS_Vector(0,0,-1) : EGS_Vector(0,0,1);
00987                 node = getNode(ix,iy,iz);
00988                 return node->region;
00989             }
00990         }
00991 
00992         return -1;
00993     }
00994 
00995 
00996     // howfar
00997     int howfar (int ireg, const EGS_Vector &r, const EGS_Vector &u, EGS_Float &t, int *newmed, EGS_Vector *normal=0) {
00998 
00999         int inew = ireg;
01000 
01001         // get new region number
01002         if (ireg==-1)
01003             inew = howfarOut (r, u, t, normal);
01004         else
01005             inew = howfarIn (nodeReg[ireg], r, u, t, normal);
01006 
01007         // set new medium
01008         if (inew>=0 && newmed) *newmed = nodeReg[inew]->medium;
01009         return inew;
01010     }
01011 
01012 
01013     // hownearIn
01014     EGS_Float hownearIn (int ireg, const EGS_Vector &r) {
01015         EGS_Octree_node *node = nodeReg[ireg];
01016         int shift = maxlevel - node->level;
01017         EGS_Float t1, t2, tx, ty, tz;
01018         int imin, imax;
01019 
01020         // x
01021         imin = node->ix << shift;
01022         imax = ~(~node->ix << shift);
01023         t1 = (r.x-xmin)-dx*imin; t2 = dx*(imax-imin+1)-t1; tx = t1 < t2 ? t1 : t2;
01024 
01025         // y
01026         imin = node->iy << shift;
01027         imax = ~(~node->iy << shift);
01028         t1 = (r.y-ymin)-dy*imin; t2 = dy*(imax-imin+1)-t1; ty = t1 < t2 ? t1 : t2;
01029 
01030         // z
01031         imin = node->iz << shift;
01032         imax = ~(~node->iz << shift);
01033         t1 = (r.z-zmin)-dz*imin; t2 = dz*(imax-imin+1)-t1; tz = t1 < t2 ? t1 : t2;
01034 
01035         return tx<ty && tx<tz ? tx : ty<tz ? ty : tz;
01036     }
01037 
01038 
01039     // hownear
01040     EGS_Float hownear (int ireg, const EGS_Vector &r) {
01041         if (ireg>=0) return hownearIn(ireg, r);
01042         int nc=0;
01043         EGS_Float s1=0, s2=0;
01044         if (r.x < bbxmin || r.x > bbxmax) {
01045             EGS_Float t = r.x < bbxmin ? bbxmin-r.x : r.x-bbxmax;
01046             nc++; s1 += t; s2 += t*t;
01047         }
01048         if (r.y < bbymin || r.y > bbymax) {
01049             EGS_Float t = r.y < bbymin ? bbymin-r.y : r.y-bbymax;
01050             nc++; s1 += t; s2 += t*t;
01051         }
01052         if (r.z < bbzmin || r.z > bbzmax) {
01053             EGS_Float t = r.z < bbzmin ? bbzmin-r.z : r.z-bbzmax;
01054             nc++; s1 += t; s2 += t*t;
01055         }
01056         return nc == 1 ? s1 : sqrt(s2);
01057     }
01058

01060     // getType
01061     const string &getType() const {
01062         return type;
01063     }

01065     // printInfo
01066     void printInfo() const;
01067 };
